trans-unit.source: Provides data for non-cancelable navigation events, including <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.LoadCompleted"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigated"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationStopped"></xref>.
Gets the root node of the target page's content.
The root element of the target page's content.
Gets an optional user-defined data object.
When you call <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> to navigate to a new page, you have the option of passing the method a user-defined data object.
That object is then assigned to this property so that you have easy access to the data when you handle the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> event.
The data object.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current navigator initiated the navigation.
This property indicates whether the current navigator is initiating the navigation or whether a parent navigator is being navigated.
For example, the current navigator might be a frame inside a page that is being navigated to inside a parent navigator.
You can use this property to determine whether to spin the globe on a `Navigating` event or to stop spinning the globe on a `LoadCompleted` event.
If this property is `false`, the navigator's parent navigator is also navigating and the globe is already spinning.
If this property is `true`, the navigation was initiated inside the current frame and you should spin the globe (or stop spinning the globe, depending on which event is being handled.)

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the navigation was initiated inside the current frame; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the parent navigator is also navigating.
Gets the navigator that raised the event
The navigator that raised the event.
Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the target page.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] of the target page.
Gets the Web response to allow access to HTTP headers and other properties.
The Web response.
